alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 11:12PM MST until July 25 at 2:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire Scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 215 AM MST. * At 1111 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire Scar. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 1.25 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Timberline, Hutchison Acres, Fernwood, Doney Park, Wupatki Trails, and Sunset Crater Volcano National Monument. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 429. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-1.25 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
